TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ComponentSerializationService extends System.Object

summary.span: 提供用于将一组组件或可序列化的对象序列化到序列化存储区的基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for serializing a set of components or serializable objects into a serialization store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将一组组件或可序列化对象序列化到序列化存储区。The serializes a set of components or serializable objects into a serialization store. 在存储区可以然后反序列化更高版本。The store can then be deserialized later. 类不同于其他序列化方案，序列化格式是不透明，并且它允许使用部分序列化的对象。The class differs from other serialization schemes in that the serialization format is opaque, and it allows for partial serialization of objects. 例如，你可以选择只序列化所选的属性的对象。For example, you can choose to serialize only selected properties for an object. 此类是`abstract`。This class is `abstract`. 通常情况下，将提供此类的具体实现，并将其添加到服务作为其。Typically, a will provide a concrete implementation of this class and add it as a service to its . 这允许以最适合的格式进行序列化的对象。This allows objects to be serialized in the format best suited for them. 类替换接口从.NET Framework 1.0 版中，尽管后者保留用于向后兼容。The class replaces the interface from the .NET Framework version 1.0, although the latter is retained for backward compatibility.

para.span: 继承自类，必须重写此类中的所有方法。

span.span: When you inherit from the class, you must override all the methods in this class.

para.span: 这些方法的一些专门用于引发异常，其相应的主题; 中所述强烈建议的派生类遵循以下准则以保持一致性的操作。

span.span: Some of these methods were designed to throw exceptions, as documented in their corresponding topics; it is strongly recommended that derived classes follow these guidelines to maintain consistency of operation.

para.span: 有关更多信息，请参见 类。

span.span: For more information, see the class.

span.span: Creates a new .

returns.span: 一个新创建的序列化存储区。

span.span: A new created serialization store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 多个对象可以序列化为相同的序列化存储区。Multiple objects can be serialized into the same serialization store. 与应用商店完成后，可以调用其或方法。When you are finished with the store, you can call its or method. 序列化存储区关闭之后，可用于反序列化，或保存到流。Once closed, a serialization store can be used for deserialization, or it can be saved into a stream. 序列化存储区可以传递给任何生成的一组对象的序列化状态的各种序列化方法。The serialization store can be passed to any of the various serializing methods to build up serialization state for a group of objects.

summary.span: 将给定存储区反序列化以产生一个对象集合。

span.span: Deserializes the given store to produce a collection of objects.

summary.span: 将给定存储区反序列化以产生一个对象集合。

span.span: Deserializes the given store to produce a collection of objects.

returns.span: 根据存储状态创建的对象集合。

span.span: A collection of objects created according to the stored state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法反序列化`store`生成它所包含的对象的集合。This method deserializes `store` to produce a collection of objects contained within it. 在其中它们进行了序列化的相同顺序反序列化对象。Objects are deserialized in the same order in which they were serialized.

span.span: The to deserialize.

param.name: container
param.span: 对象将要添加到的容器。

span.span: The container to which objects will be added.

summary.span: 将给定的 反序列化为给定的容器。

span.span: Deserializes the given to the given container.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法反序列化`store`，但而不是生成新对象，它将存储区中的数据应用到一组现有的执行从所提供的容器的对象。The method deserializes `store`, but instead of producing new objects, it applies the data in the store to an existing set of objects that are taken from the provided container. 因此，调用方可以提前创建对象但它认为合适。As a result, the caller can create in advance an object however it sees fit. 如果对象已反序列化状态，并且该对象不是集中的现有对象，将创建一个新的对象。If an object has a deserialization state and the object is not named in the set of existing objects, a new object will be created. 如果该对象还实现，它将添加到`container`。If that object also implements , it will be added to `container`. 容器中的对象必须具有名称和匹配中使用的现有对象的顺序的序列化存储区中的对象的类型。Objects in the container must have names and types that match objects in the serialization store in order for an existing object to be used.

exception.span: 或 为 。

span.span: or is .

exception.span: 不包含任何具有序列化容器可以处理的格式的数据。

span.span: does not contain data in a format the serialization container can process.

span.span: The to which the state of will be serialized.
The object to serialize.

summary.span: 根据默认属性值序列化给定对象。

span.span: Serializes the given object, accounting for default property values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 标准序列化，在实现中通过方法，只序列化不同于组件的默认状态的值。Standard serialization, as implemented through the method, only serializes values that differ from the component's default state. 这提供了最紧凑的序列化机制，但假定将反序列化期间使用新创建的对象。This provides the most compact serialization mechanism but assumes that a newly created object will be used during deserialization. 如果使用的现有对象，则不保证生成的反序列化的对象要复制的原始状态的序列化的对象;包含序列化期间的默认值的属性将不重置回其默认设置反序列化过程。If an existing object is used, the resulting deserialized object is not guaranteed to duplicate the original state of the serialized object; the properties that contained default values during serialization will not be reset back to their defaults during deserialization. 方法不使用此快捷方式。The method does not use this shortcut. 其序列化的源对象的所有属性，以便反序列化可以还原所有对象的属性，而不考虑默认状态。It serializes all properties of the source object so that deserialization can restore all the object's properties, regardless of default state. 此方法是对序列化集合，特别有用，因为构成项集合中的顺序可以更改。This method is particularly useful for serializing collections, because the order of the constituent items within the collection can change. 在这种情况下，最安全的过程，以还原整个集合的原始状态是覆盖所有原始属性值的所有项。In this circumstance, the safest process to restore the original state of the entire collection is to overwrite all the items with all their original property values.

exception.span: 或 为 。

span.span: is closed, or is not a supported type of serialization store.

span.span: Use a store returned by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可以在多次调用相同的对象，若要生成的序列化存储区中的序列化成员的列表。The method can be invoked multiple times for the same object to build up a list of serialized members within the serialization store. 一般情况下，该成员应为一个属性或事件。In general, the member should be a property or an event.

The member to serialize.

summary.span: 根据默认属性值，序列化给定对象上的给定成员。

span.span: Serializes the given member on the given object, accounting for the default property value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法序列化`member`上`owningObject`，即使`member`包含默认属性值。The method serializes the `member` on `owningObject`, even if `member` contains the default property value. 请注意，对于某些成员包含的默认值并将相同的值的设置还原到该成员是不同的概念。Note that for some members, containing the default value and restoring the setting of the same value to the member are different concepts. 例如，如果属性从父对象继承其值设置没有本地值时，将值设置到的属性可能正确的结果。For example, if a property inherits its value from a parent object when no local value is set, setting the value back to the property may not be what is desired. 方法考虑了这一点，并会在这种情况下清除该属性的状态。The method takes this into account and would clear the state of the property in this case.
